boat.full_description:
Pierce Eye was the seventh centreboard One Design built by Brooke and Hall for the Walton & Frinton Yacht Club. She was designed by Morgan Giles, built in 1921 with sail no. 7 on white sails with an emerald green hull.

Pierce Eye was badly damaged over the years, and purchased jointly in the 1980s, with the decision to build a replica from ballast keel up. Robin Williams was given copies of the Morgan Giles drawings by John Hall, boatyard owner in Walton-on-the-Naze. On the sad passing of co-owner, Les Bowen, Robin was bequeathed mast, spars, some rigging and sails.

The sail has enabled us to confirm the record in the Boat Register, curiously having the '7' in a different and older fabric. The last One Design to be built was No.'7' and on joining the OGA the boat was given boat no. 473, which became her new sail number, we can only assume.

The rebuild is still underway at Robin's workshop in Buckfastleigh, Devon, with her original ballast keel, bronze fittings and spars (except the boom), based on the original drawings.
